talk.author: did:plc:b43r2ysiyablfjq6it36u6yx
talk.utter: Zoning laws are a big part of the problem too, obviously. Height restrictions, single-family vs. multifamily, that sort of thing. Affordable housing subsidies are also way too small. There's a of of other forces preventing people from building. Those would be there in any case, though.

talk.author: did:plc:b43r2ysiyablfjq6it36u6yx
talk.utter: None of which is to say that it's helpful for speculators to enter the market.

talk.author: did:plc:b43r2ysiyablfjq6it36u6yx
talk.utter: You sound like my realtor mother-in-law - in other words, someone whose priorities horrify me. If you're choosing a home for money and not love, in my opinion, you deserve to lose your shirt.
